modName: CHYAL - Change How Your Armor Looks
summary: Adds Glamour spells to temporarily change the visual of your equipped armor
descriptionHtml:
[size=3]This is a simple quality of life mod to temporarily change the visual of your amor. How it work is that on install, you'll be given two lesser powers, [b]Glamour Self[/b] and [b]Glamour Others[/b]. When casted, the script will ask you to input some text, unequip the armor you're wearing, change its display model path base on your input and re-equip the armor. Change the model path to what, you ask? Read on to the Configuration section

[b][u]Features:[/u][/b]
[list=1]
[*]Changes only the visual of your armor, not creating a duplicate copy, all enchantments, keyword, and tempered status remain intact
[*]No need to activate the ESP of a new armor mod, can save some esp slots
[*]The effects is temporary, and do not go into your save file, no chance of save corruption, bloating or anything
[*]Scripts are only ran when you cast the lesser power and do not modify any actor values, safe to uninstall any time
[/list]
[b][u]Configuration[/u][/b]:
After installation, you'll see these files
Data\SKSE\plugins\FISS\CHYAL_Player.xml
Data\SKSE\plugins\FISS\CHYAL_Lydia.xml
Data\SKSE\plugins\FISS\CHYAL_BloodMage.xml

These pre-provided files are just example, you are expected to add, edit, and delete them yourselves. CHYAL_Player.xml is used when you cast on yourself and just cancel the text input (tab key default), CHYAL_Lydia.xml is used when you cast it on Lydia and cancel the input, CHYAL_BloodMage.xml is used when you cast on anyone and entered [i]bloodmage [/i]on the text input (provided you have that bloodmage mesh and texture installed).

The format of these files are all the same and is pretty self-explanatory. Open them with any text editor.
For example: 
<bodyModelPath>Armor\Nightingale\F\Torso_1.nif</bodyModelPath>
[list]
[*]The paths are relative to Data\meshes
[*]Most armor have different model for male and female
[*]Most armor have different model for 1st person or 3rd person (usually denote by the _1 at the end)
[/list]
Another follower? Just make a copy of the CHYAL_Lydia.xml and replace [i]Lydia [/i]with the name of the follower.

[b][u]Caveat:
[/u][/b][list]
[*]The effect is in memory only, it'll persist through loading a save file, but if the armor get reloaded into memory, the effect is lost. So far, I only notice placing the armor into a container triggers a armor  reload, and of-course quit and restart the game.
[*]This will effect NPCs of the same sex and wearing the same armor, no other way around this that I can see.
[*]This mod essentially do the same thing as opening up TES5Edit and manually change the model path of the armor addon, and reverting it after quitting the game. I was doing this for every new armor upgrade and I got really tire of it and thus created this mod.
[/list]
